direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods return sets derived from the map, but for different purposes (entries vs. keys).
Both methods return collections derived from the map, but for different purposes (entries vs. values).
Both methods involve iterating over map elements, but in different forms (set of entries vs. iterator).
Both methods handle the creation of unmodifiable sets from map entries.

enhanced_by.reason: Initializes the map to be unmodifiable, which is a prerequisite for entrySet().
Accesses the map's elements, similar to entrySet(), but through an iterator.
Both methods handle map access and can be used to verify map state post-operation.
